headline.main: 4,000 Marijuana Smokers Rally; Exhibit Little Fear of Herbicides; Urge Legalisation of Substance--Survey Finds 36% of Samples Have Some Residue of Paraquat Acute Symptoms Found Police Are Mobilized Substance Highly Toxic Study's Limitations Cited

docs.abstract: Approximately 4,000 persons rally, Washington, DC, to press for legalization of marijuana; many exhibit little fear of herbicides; survey finds 36% of marijuana entering US from Mex contains lethal herbicide paraquat; demonstrators illus (M)

byline.original: By JANET BATTAILE Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 4--A preliminary Government survey shows that 36 percent of tested marijuana samples contain some residue of the highly poisonous herbicide paraquat.
docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 4--A preliminary Government survey shows that 36 percent of tested marijuana samples contain some residue of the highly poisonous herbicide paraquat.

headline.main: State Cancer Drive Focuses on Women; State Cancer Drive Focuses on Women

docs.abstract: NJ div of Amer Cancer Soc mounts antismoking campaign aimed at young women; div spokesman Kenneth W Steffan comments (M)

keywords.value: TOBACCO, TOBACCO PRODUCTS AND SMOKERS ARTICLES
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: UNION THE New Jersey division of the American Cancer Society is mounting an educational offensive against smoking by teenage girls and "young women."
docs.snippet: UNION THE New Jersey division of the  American Cancer Society is mounting an educational offensive against smoking by teenage girls and "young women."
